ActivityTitle: Air Pressure Systems in the Northern Hemisphere
QuestionStem: Earth rotates, so wind does not blow in a straight line. In the Northern Hemisphere, air spirals counterclockwise around a low-pressure system and clockwise around a high-pressure system.

content.imageAlt: In this illustration, high and low pressure systems are shown, along with the type of weather they produce.

panels.title: High-pressure system
panels.description: Air sinks toward Earthâ€™s surface into an area of high pressure. Then the air spirals out toward areas of lower pressure.

panels.title: Low-pressure system
panels.description: Air along the ground spirals inward toward an area of low pressure. Here, the air rises higher into the atmosphere and cools.
